entry.dcterms:title: TÁRKI Omnibus 2002/1. Social-political attitudes in Hungary among the adult population.
entry.dcterms:creator: Zsadányi-Nagy, Csaba
entry.dcterms:subject: TÁRKI Joint Research Center TDATA-F17: TÁRKI Omnibus 2002/1. Social-political attitudes in Hungary among the adult population.. data sheet. Version: 2007-01-19

entry.dcterms:description: 1) party preferences, popularity of politicians, evaluation of Prime Minister candidates, evaluating the work of the government and opposition, satisfaction with democracy, political attitudes, economic expectations, subjective financial situation 2) government intervention in the stimulation of the economy, evaluation of the governmental economic, foreign and social policy, sociopolitical expectations towards the government, opinions abot the status law 3) feeling of insecurity, trust in the future, secure livelihood, experiencing and evaluating security and insecurity, opinions and attitudes about the state, market-based society, competition, regime change 4) getting the car fixed 5) habits of taking a holiday
entry.dcterms:subject: mass political behavior, attitudes
political ideology
income, property and savings
social welfare policy and systems
leisure, tourism and sport
transport, travel (and mobility)
person
survey data
cross-section

A multi-stage proportionally stratified random probability sample representative of the Hungarian adult population. Unsuccessful inquiries were substituted with supplementary addresses, where persons to be interviewed were selected on the basis of the Leslie Kish key.
face-to-face interview
block 1: A, block 2: A, block 3: D, block 4: D, block 5: A
entry.dcterms:rights: Publications based on TÁRKI data collections should acknowledge those sources, primary investigators and depositors.
